intro: Eugenia lundellii, commonly known as the Lecanora lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is a symbiotic organism composed of a fungal partner and a photosynthetic alga or cyanobacterium. This lichen is typically found growing on rocks, bark, or soil in temperate and tropical regions. It is characterized by its crust-like growth form and can vary in color from greenish to yellowish. Eugenia lundellii plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its habitat.
